lexUnit.name: derail.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: cause to be unable to successfully complete

sentence.text: The plan for a six-week display in a buffet at Newcastle upon Tyne 's Central Station was derailed after a duty manager looked at the pictures by a French photographer at a preview .
But it is that which could ultimately derail his campaign , because as the pressure for a clear decision forces Government MPs off the fence , Urquhart is the candidate who could suffer most .
Speaking to BBC radio , Lawrence Eagleburger said the US had done what it could for an agreement on farm subsidies , which had derailed the talks .
CAMBRIDGE University 's Boat Race trials were derailed yesterday when one of the three crews hit a floating sleeper on the Thames at Putney , tearing a long gash in the hull .
But the war has clearly derailed the timetable .
Samsung 's initial plans were derailed by Hewlett-Packard 's difficulties in getting floating point processing units out of Texas Instruments Inc .

However Shamir 's formal reply on June 6 to Bush 's letter rejected Bush 's compromise , according to press reports , and accused Arab countries of " derailing the real purpose " of the proposed conference .
The weaker figures will renew pressure on Chancellor Norman Lamont to consider another interest rate cut to ensure the upturn is not derailed .
Details of the plot , seen by some as an attempt to derail the negotiations , threatened to jeopardize the second round of talks between the ANC and the government scheduled for Aug. 6 .
Massacre wo n't derail peace process
DRAYTON Asia 's reconstruction proposals , issued on Friday to derail EFM Dragon 's takeover attempt , have been rejected , writes Gordon Milne .
PRESIDENT Boris Yeltsin called yesterday for an urgent session of the country 's highest legislature to end a power struggle threatening to derail his reform plans .
` It would be unfortunate , " said Paul , ` if he were to be derailed at this point . "
According to diplomatic sources , Baker warned that failure to address the charges could derail the peace process .
